TopicTitle: What's a good way to film something in KSP?

Articles.Content:
I have a boat base on the way to Laythe, and I'd like to record the orbital interception and landing. It might be very cool. So how would I do that?

Edited August 14, 2018 by Zosma Procyon

You can use the GeForce Experience, which can be installed with nVidia drivers or any other video capturing software. Then you can process the video using MS Movie Maker or any other video processing software and upload the result to YouTube or any other video hosting.
You should talk to @Cupcake..., he makes some amazing videos. He seems to know all the tricks, as sometimes I have no idea how on Earth he gets his shots.

I've hare some luck with OBS. But, I don't have the graphics or CPU horses to run it and KSP and get a good frame rate capture. Still looking for something better.

Long live my seven year old potato powered toaster.

Edited August 14, 2018 by steuben

If you happen to run Windows 8 or 10 it has a handy screen recorder built in, just press Win-Alt-R and it should start recording whatever window you have active. You may have to mark it as a game first, though.

You need screen capture software, others have already mentioned some.  To add some polish, you could add a KSP camera mod, that allows you to position the camera in positions that stock just can't do.
